column2: Unifi, Inc. engages in the manufacture and sale of synthetic and recycled products made from polyester and nylon. The company is headquartered in Greensboro, North Carolina and currently employs 2,860 full-time employees. The firm processes and sells commodity yarns, specialized yarns and premier value-added (PVA) yarns. The firm operates through three segments: Polyester segment, Nylon segment and International segment. The firm's polyester products include polyester polymer beads (Chip), partially oriented yarn (POY), textured, solution and package dyed, twisted, beamed and draw wound yarns. Each polyester product is available in virgin or recycled varieties, where the recycled is made from both pre-consumer yarn waste and post-consumer waste, including plastic bottles. The firm's nylon products include textured, solution dyed and spandex covered products. The firm's products include REPREVE, Sorbtek, Reflexx, aio, Augusta and A.M.Y. The firm's principal geographic markets for its products are located in North America, Central America, South America and Asia.
